casai_mobileads.name: CAS.AI Mobile Ads
casai_mobileads.description: The CAS.AI Construct plugin allows you to easily monetize your apps for iOS and Android using lot of Ads SDKs in mediation.

ios-cas-id.name: CAS Id (iTunes Id)
ios-cas-id.desc: In most cases, a CAS ID is the same as your app store ID. You can leave the 'demo' value only for testing purposes.

ios-solutions.name: Solutions
ios-solutions.desc: Include mediation solution for iOS. Valid values 'Optimal' or 'Famileis', and '-' for none.

ios-adapters.name: Adapters
ios-adapters.desc: List of included iOS mediation adapter names, separated by ',', ';', or space. For example: 'GoogleAds,IronSource,DTExchange'

ios-adapters-link.name: Adapters
ios-adapters-link.desc: Table of supported adapters for iOS platform.

ios-tracking-usage.name: Tracking Usage Description
ios-tracking-usage.desc: Required to display the App Tracking Transparency authorization request for accessing the IDFA in iOS.

android-solutions.name: Solutions
android-solutions.desc: Include mediation solution for Android. Valid values 'Optimal' or 'Famileis', and '-' for none.

android-adapters.name: Adapters
android-adapters.desc: List of included Android mediation adapter names, separated by ',', ';', or space. For example: 'googleAds,ironSource,dtExchange'

android-adapters-link.name: Adapters
android-adapters-link.desc: Table of supported adapters for Android platform.

android-use-ad-id.name: Use Ad ID
android-use-ad-id.desc: Is allowed Google AD_ID to use. Valid values 'true' and 'false'.

app-info.name: App Information
app-info.desc: Fill in your app information to improve ad targeting specifically for your users.

target-audience.name: Target Audience
target-audience.desc: Indicates the target audience of the app for regulatory and content purposes. This may affect how the CAS handles data collection, personalization, and content rendering, especially for audiences such as children. The value can remain unknown, in which case the settings from our platform will be applied.

app-keywords.name: App Keywords
app-keywords.desc: Sets a list of keywords, interests, or intents related to your application, separated by ','. Words or phrases describing the current activity of the user for targeting purposes.

app-content-url.name: App Content URL
app-content-url.desc: Sets the content URL for a website whose content matches the app's primary content. This website content is used for targeting and brand safety purposes.

mediation-extras.name: Mediation Extras
mediation-extras.desc: Additional custom parameters passed to mediation networks. In JSON format.

automation.name: Automation Options
automation.desc: CAS offers automation features to simplify working with ads.

auto-show-consent-form.name: Consent Form Auto Show If Required
auto-show-consent-form.desc: The CAS loads a form and presents it on startup if the consent status is required. Shows the consent form only if it is required and the user has not responded previously.

auto-load-banner.name: Banner Ad Auto load
auto-load-banner.desc: Automatically loads ads retry loading the ad if an error occurs during the loading process. Attention: unlike other formats, for automatic loading to work you need to trigger banner ad loading at least once and specify the required size.

auto-refresh-banner.name: Banner Ad Auto Refresh
auto-refresh-banner.desc: Interval (in seconds) for refreshing banner ads. Once elapsed, a new ad automatically loads and displays. Set 0 to disable auto refresh ad.

auto-load-mrec.name: MREC Ad Auto load
auto-load-mrec.desc: Automatically loads ads on startup and retry loading the ad if an error occurs during the loading process.

auto-refresh-mrec.name: MREC Ad Auto Refresh
auto-refresh-mrec.desc: Interval (in seconds) for refreshing banner ads. Once elapsed, a new ad automatically loads and displays. Set 0 to disable auto refresh ad.

auto-load-appopen.name: AppOpen Ad Auto load
auto-load-appopen.desc: Automatically loads ads on startup and after they are shown and retries on load errors.

auto-show-appopen.name: AppOpen Ad Auto Show
auto-show-appopen.desc: Automatically show ads when the user resumes a previously launched app. This automation does not mean the ad will be shown immediately upon loading.

auto-load-inter.name: Interstitial Ad Auto load
auto-load-inter.desc: Automatically loads ads on startup and after they are shown and retries on load errors.

auto-show-inter.name: Interstitial Ad Auto Show
auto-show-inter.desc: Automatically show ads when the user resumes a previously launched app. This automation does not mean the ad will be shown immediately upon loading.

min-interval-inter.name: Interstitials Ad Min Interval
min-interval-inter.desc: Minimum time (in seconds) required between interstitial ad displays.

auto-load-reward.name: Rewarded Ad Auto load
auto-load-reward.desc: Automatically loads ads on startup and after they are shown and retries on load errors.

collect-location.name: Collect Location
collect-location.desc: Collect from the device the latitude and longitude coordinates truncated to the hundredths decimal place.

trial-ad-free-interval.name: Trial Ad-Free Interval
trial-ad-free-interval.desc: Interval (in seconds) starting from the moment of the initial app installation, during which users can use the application without ads being displayed while still retaining access to the Rewarded Ads format. Within this interval, users enjoy privileged access to the application's features without intrusive advertisements.

development.name: Development options
development.desc: We strongly suggest that you enable test ads mode when you validate the integration. If you click on too many ads without being in test mode, you risk your account being flagged for invalid activity.

force-test-ads.name: Force Test Ads
force-test-ads.desc: Enable test ads mode that will always return test ads for all devices. [b]Don't forget to set it to False after the tests are completed.[/b]

test-device-ids.name: Test Device IDs
test-device-ids.desc: List of test device ID corresponding to test devices which will always request test ads. Separator ','

debug-logging.name: Debug Logging
debug-logging.desc: The enabled Debug Mode will display a lot of useful information for debugging about the states of the SDK with log tag CAS.AI. If you have discovered the problem in the work of the CAS, please provide us with a description of the problem along with the full log of your device.

debug-geography.name: Debug Geography
debug-geography.desc: Overrides detected geography for testing privacy behavior. Only effective in test sessions.

show-consent-form.description: Displays the consent form to the user

if-required-only.name: If required only
if-required-only.desc: Shows the consent form only if it is required and the user has not responded previously.

set-ad-sounds-muted.description: Indicates if the application’s audio is muted. Affects initial mute state for fullscreen ads. Use this method only if your application has its own volume controls (e.g., custom music or sound effect muting).

is-muted.name: Is Muted
is-muted.desc: Initial mute state for fullscreen ads.

load-banner-ad.description: Loads a banner ad with specified size. [b]The ad will not be displayed on the screen until the show action is performed.[/b] This action works asynchronously, and you can use the 'Wait for previous actions to complete' action to wait until the ad has been loaded or failed to load.

ad-size.name: Ad Size
ad-size.desc: The size of the banner ad. The banner can only have one ad size at a time. Calling the load action with a different size will destroy the loaded ad and load a new one with the requested size.

max-width.name: Max Width
max-width.desc: The maximum width of the banner ad in DP. Leave 0 to not limit. Used to limit Adaptive and Inline banners only.

max-height.name: Max Height
max-height.desc: The maximum height of the banner ad in DP. Leave 0 to not limit. Used to limit Inline banners only.

show-banner-ad.display-text: Show banner ad at [i]{0}[/i] with offset ([i]{1}[/i], [i]{2}[/i])
show-banner-ad.description: Displays the banner ad at the specified position with optional offsets. The banner’s position can be changed at any time by performing this action with new parameters.

position.name: Position
position.desc: The position on the screen to display the banner ad. The CAS will not allow an ad to be placed outside the screen or overlap with screen cutouts. Some anchor positions do not support offset on the X or Y axis, this can be seen as (X, Y).

x-offset.name: X Offset
x-offset.desc: The horizontal offset from the specified position in DP. Leave 0 to not use offset.

y-offset.name: Y Offset
y-offset.desc: The vertical offset from the specified position in DP. Leave 0 to not use offset.

hide-banner-ad.description: Hides the currently displayed banner ad.

destroy-banner-ad.description: Destroys the banner ad instance and frees up resources. To resume working with ads, use the load ad action.

load-mrec-ad.description: Loads a medium rectangle (MREC) ad. [b]The ad will not be displayed on the screen until the show action is performed.[/b] This action works asynchronously, and you can use the 'Wait for previous actions to complete' action to wait until the ad has been loaded or failed to load.

show-mrec-ad.display-text: Show MREC ad at at [i]{0}[/i] with offset ([i]{1}[/i], [i]{2}[/i])
show-mrec-ad.description: Displays the MREC ad at the specified position with optional offsets. The ad position can be changed at any time by performing this action with new parameters.

position.name: Position
position.desc: The position on the screen to display the MREC ad. The CAS will not allow an ad to be placed outside the screen or overlap with screen cutouts. Some anchor positions do not support offset on the X or Y axis, this can be seen as (X, Y).

x-offset.name: X Offset
x-offset.desc: The horizontal offset from the specified position in DP. Leave 0 to not use offset.

y-offset.name: Y Offset
y-offset.desc: The vertical offset from the specified position in DP. Leave 0 to not use offset.

hide-mrec-ad.description: Hides the currently displayed MREC ad.

destroy-mrec-ad.description: Destroys the MREC ad instance and frees up resources. To resume working with ads, use the load ad action.

load-app-open-ad.description: Loads an AppOpen ad. This action works asynchronously, and you can use the 'Wait for previous actions to complete' action to wait until the ad has been loaded or failed to load.

show-app-open-ad.description: Displays the AppOpen ad. There is no need to check whether the ad is loaded before showing it. This action works asynchronously, and you can use the 'Wait for previous actions to complete' action to wait until the ad has been dismissed or failed to show.

destroy-app-open-ad.description: Destroys the app open ad instance and frees up resources. To resume working with ads, use the load ad action.

load-interstitial-ad.description: Loads an Interstitial ad. This action works asynchronously, and you can use the 'Wait for previous actions to complete' action to wait until the ad has been loaded or failed to load.

show-interstitial-ad.description: Displays the interstitial ad. There is no need to check whether the ad is loaded before showing it. This action works asynchronously, and you can use the 'Wait for previous actions to complete' action to wait until the ad has been dismissed or failed to show.

destroy-interstitial-ad.description: Destroys the Interstitial ad instance and frees up resources. To resume working with ads, use the load ad action.

load-rewarded-ad.description: Loads a rewarded ad. This action works asynchronously, and you can use the 'Wait for previous actions to complete' action to wait until the ad has been loaded or failed to load.

show-rewarded-ad.description: Displays the rewarded ad. Use the 'On Ad User Earned Reward' trigger to reward the user. There is no need to check whether the ad is loaded before showing it. This action works asynchronously, and you can use the 'Wait for previous actions to complete' action to wait until the ad has been dismissed or failed to show.

destroy-rewarded-ad.description: Destroys the rewarded ad instance and frees up resources. To resume working with ads, call the load ad action.

on-consent-form-dismissed.description: Triggered when the consent form is dismissed after CAS initialization or manual consent form show.

on-consent-required.description: Triggered when user consent is required  after CAS initialization or manual consent form show.

on-consent-not-required.description: Triggered when user consent is not required after CAS initialization or manual consent flow show..

is-consent-required.description: Checks if user consent is required.

on-banner-ad-loaded.description: Triggered when a banner ad is successfully loaded.

on-banner-ad-failed-to-load.display-text: On banner ad failed to load
on-banner-ad-failed-to-load.description: Triggered when a banner ad fails to load.

on-banner-ad-clicked.description: Triggered when a banner ad is clicked.

is-banner-ad-loaded.description: Checks if a banner ad is loaded.

on-mrec-ad-loaded.description: Triggered when a medium rectangle (MREC) ad is successfully loaded.

on-mrec-ad-failed-to-load.display-text: On MREC ad failed to load
on-mrec-ad-failed-to-load.description: Triggered when a medium rectangle (MREC) ad fails to load.

on-mrec-ad-clicked.description: Triggered when a medium rectangle (MREC) ad is clicked.

is-mrec-ad-loaded.description: Checks if a medium rectangle (MREC) ad is loaded.

on-app-open-ad-loaded.description: Triggered when an app open ad is successfully loaded.

on-app-open-ad-failed-to-load.display-text: On app open ad failed to load
on-app-open-ad-failed-to-load.description: Triggered when an app open ad fails to load.

on-app-open-ad-failed-to-show.display-text: On app open ad failed to show
on-app-open-ad-failed-to-show.description: Triggered when an app open ad fails to show.

on-app-open-ad-showed.description: Triggered when an app open ad is shown.

on-app-open-ad-clicked.description: Triggered when an app open ad is clicked.

on-app-open-ad-dismissed.description: Triggered when an app open ad is dismissed.

is-app-open-ad-loaded.description: Checks if an app open ad is loaded.

on-interstitial-ad-loaded.description: Triggered when an interstitial ad is successfully loaded.

on-interstitial-ad-failed-to-load.display-text: On interstitial ad failed to load
on-interstitial-ad-failed-to-load.description: Triggered when an interstitial ad fails to load.

on-interstitial-ad-failed-to-show.display-text: On interstitial ad failed to show
on-interstitial-ad-failed-to-show.description: Triggered when an interstitial ad fails to show.

on-interstitial-ad-showed.description: Triggered when an interstitial ad is shown.

on-interstitial-ad-clicked.description: Triggered when an interstitial ad is clicked.

on-interstitial-ad-dismissed.description: Triggered when an interstitial ad is dismissed.

is-interstitial-ad-loaded.description: Checks if an interstitial ad is loaded.

on-rewarded-ad-loaded.description: Triggered when a rewarded ad is successfully loaded.

on-rewarded-ad-failed-to-load.display-text: On rewarded ad failed to load
on-rewarded-ad-failed-to-load.description: Triggered when a rewarded ad fails to load.

on-rewarded-ad-failed-to-show.display-text: On rewarded ad failed to show
on-rewarded-ad-failed-to-show.description: Triggered when a rewarded ad fails to show.

on-rewarded-ad-showed.description: Triggered when a rewarded ad is shown.

on-rewarded-ad-clicked.description: Triggered when a rewarded ad is clicked.

on-rewarded-ad-dismissed.description: Triggered when a rewarded ad is dismissed.

on-rewarded-ad-user-earned-reward.display-text: On rewarded ad user earned reward
on-rewarded-ad-user-earned-reward.description: Triggered when the user earns a reward from a rewarded ad.

on-rewarded-ad-canceled-by-user.display-text: On rewarded ad canceled by user
on-rewarded-ad-canceled-by-user.description: Triggered when the user cancel a rewarded ad and must not earn reward.

is-rewarded-ad-loaded.description: Checks if a rewarded ad is loaded.

initialization-error.description: Gets the initialization error message if any.

user-country-code.description: Gets the user's country ISO 2 code based on their IP address. For example: 'US' or '--' if unknown.

consent-status.description: Gets the current status of the consent form: 'Unknown', 'Obtained' 'Not required', 'Unavailable', 'Internal error', 'Network error', 'Invalid context', 'Still presenting'

error-message.description: When in a failure (load/show) condition, an error message related to it.
